page.title: 07THE KENNELS AT KNOTTING
page.content:
Mr. Bellamy runs the Oakley Hunt Kennels at Knotting. He cares for 32 couples of hounds, used in fox hunts. The hounds have to be fit and healthy and well fed.
Every morning at 6 a.m. all the hounds are exercised. They are taken for a walk with Mr. Bellamy and the kennel-man. They are given one main meal every two days. The meal consists of any type of animal flesh. This is eaten raw, on the bone, because gnawing makes the hounds' jaws strong. The hounds live in lodges, large, airy concrete pens which are scrubbed thoroughly once a week. The hounds are bathed twice a year.
